head.title: An American Town Meeting: The Issue Is Race; The Church

hedline.hl1: An American Town Meeting: The Issue Is Race; The Church

abstract.p: Yomi A Forsh-Hamilton letter responds to June 4 article Shared Prayers, Mixed Blessings, in series How Race Is Lived in America; contends new attitudes can be learned, though article illustrates how much progress still need to be made

block.p: Re ''Shared Prayers, Mixed Blessings'' (front page, June 4):

Some of the people in your article are grown adults who underestimate themselves by continuing to use their upbringing as a crutch or justification for the ignorant and racist attitudes they still hold toward others not like themselves.
Re ''Shared Prayers, Mixed Blessings'' (front page, June 4):

Some of the people in your article are grown adults who underestimate themselves by continuing to use their upbringing as a crutch or justification for the ignorant and racist attitudes they still hold toward others not like themselves.

Just as behavior is learned, we can reprogram ourselves to learn new attitudes. It is to be hoped that your article will open up discussions among people, but it is an example of how much progress still needs to be made.
